alert.note: Alert for St. Francois (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 6:41PM CDT until April 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN JEFFERSON...STE. GENEVIEVE AND EASTERN ST. FRANCOIS COUNTIES... At 640 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles west of Rocky Ridge to Farmington, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters reported downed powerlines southwest of Leadwood. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Ste. Genevieve, Park Hills, Bloomsdale, St. Mary, Womac, Knob Lick, Rocky Ridge, Weingarten, Coffman, Leadington, Minnith, Libertyville, Doe Run, River Aux Vases, and French Village. This also includes Hawn State Park and Felix Valle House State Park. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 141 and 170. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Illinois...and southeastern and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
